ODWGtools 0.5.0.9000
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Outlier Detection

Median absolute deviation test for outliers

mad_outliers.Rd

Performs a median absolute deviation (MAD) test for outliers.

mad_outliers(x, mask = !is.na(x), threshold = c(1.5, 3), return.score = FALSE)

Arguments

x

A vector of data.
mask

A logical mask that identifies a subgroup of x to compute non-parametric statistics on. Useful when a subset of quality-assured data is available. Default action is to ignore NA values.
threshold

A length-two vector identifying thresholds for "mild" and "extreme" outliers.
return.score

if TRUE, return the numeric outlier score. If FALSE, return an ordered factor classifying the observations as one of "not outlier" (1), "mild outlier" (2), or "extreme outlier" (3).

Details

the values of threshold identify the multiplier of the median distance used to identify mild and extreme outliers. Default values are 1.5 for "mild" outliers and 3.0 for "extreme" outliers.

Examples

x = seq(0, 34, by = 0.25)*pi     
noise = rlnorm(length(x), meanlog = 1, sdlog = 3)
y=sin(x) + noise
mask = noise < 1

mad_outliers(y)

#>   [1] mild outlier    mild outlier    extreme outlier not outlier    
#>   [5] not outlier     not outlier     extreme outlier mild outlier   
#>   [9] not outlier     not outlier     not outlier     not outlier    
#>  [13] not outlier     not outlier     mild outlier    not outlier    
#>  [17] not outlier     extreme outlier not outlier     not outlier    
#>  [21] not outlier     not outlier     mild outlier    not outlier    
#>  [25] not outlier     not outlier     extreme outlier extreme outlier
#>  [29] not outlier     extreme outlier not outlier     not outlier    
#>  [33] not outlier     not outlier     mild outlier    not outlier    
#>  [37] not outlier     extreme outlier mild outlier    not outlier    
#>  [41] not outlier     not outlier     not outlier     not outlier    
#>  [45] not outlier     mild outlier    mild outlier    mild outlier   
#>  [49] not outlier     not outlier     not outlier     not outlier    
#>  [53] not outlier     not outlier     not outlier     mild outlier   
#>  [57] not outlier     extreme outlier extreme outlier not outlier    
#>  [61] extreme outlier mild outlier    not outlier     mild outlier   
#>  [65] not outlier     not outlier     not outlier     not outlier    
#>  [69] not outlier     mild outlier    extreme outlier not outlier    
#>  [73] not outlier     not outlier     not outlier     not outlier    
#>  [77] extreme outlier mild outlier    not outlier     not outlier    
#>  [81] not outlier     extreme outlier not outlier     not outlier    
#>  [85] not outlier     mild outlier    not outlier     not outlier    
#>  [89] not outlier     not outlier     not outlier     not outlier    
#>  [93] mild outlier    not outlier     extreme outlier mild outlier   
#>  [97] not outlier     not outlier     not outlier     not outlier    
#> [101] not outlier     not outlier     not outlier     extreme outlier
#> [105] mild outlier    extreme outlier not outlier     not outlier    
#> [109] extreme outlier not outlier     not outlier     mild outlier   
#> [113] not outlier     not outlier     not outlier     not outlier    
#> [117] mild outlier    mild outlier    not outlier     not outlier    
#> [121] not outlier     extreme outlier not outlier     not outlier    
#> [125] not outlier     not outlier     mild outlier    not outlier    
#> [129] not outlier     not outlier     not outlier     not outlier    
#> [133] not outlier     not outlier     extreme outlier mild outlier   
#> [137] not outlier    
#> Levels: not outlier < mild outlier < extreme outlier
mad_outliers(y, mask)
